p: On the plain territory of the Komi Republic, a pronounced latitudinal-nature zonation occurs. The extreme north-east is taken by a subzone of the southern tundra. The forest-tundra is a transition zone between the tundra and taiga. In the Pechora Province, it has a width of 100â€“120 km forming the southern periphery of the territory that has the Bolshezemelskaya tundra. The main type of vegetation in the Republic of Komi is the boreal (taiga) forest. The taiga zone is divided into the following subzones: Extreme northern, Northern, Middle, and Southern. The eastern edge of the Republic in occupied by the Ural Mountains, where altitudinal zonation occurs with distinct Mountain forest, Alpine tundra, and Cold deserts zones ( Gorchakovskij 1975).
